intro: Macromeria guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan macromeria, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as montane forests. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Macromeria guatemalensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
